intro: Quercus femina, commonly known as the female oak, is a deciduous tree native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The tree is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in the autumn. Its acorns are an important food source for various wildlife species. Quercus femina typically grows to a height of 20–30 meters and thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure.
